Over 2,000 poems eulogize Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Over 2,000 poems eulogize Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Korean poets have written at least 2,000 poems eulogizing the greatness and immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung for the last 7 years since July 1994.
 Among them are epics "Comrade Kim Il Sung, Our Eternal Leader," "The Leader Will Always Be With Us" and "The Pyongyang Time Will Be Eternal" and lyrics "Oh  Our Leader," "Great Immortality," "Time of Korea" and "Lay of Korea in 1997."    
 The poems represent his greatness about which people failed to know in his lifetime, their high praise of his immortal exploits and their noble idea that the president lives forever thanks to leader Kim Jong Il.

Message of sympathy to Peruvian President
articles.content:
Message of sympathy to Peruvian President 
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 28 sent a message of sympathy to Peruvian President Valentin Paniagua Corazao in connection with the great damage done to the southern part of Peru by a strong earthquake.
 Upon hearing the news that the southern part of Peru was hard hit by a strong earthquake on June 23, the message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the people in the afflicted area and hoped that the Peruvian government and people would recover from the earthquake damage  and bring the living of the population in the afflicted area to normal at an early date.

articles.title: Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President 
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 2 sent a message of greetings to President of Rwanda Paul Kagame on the occasion of its national day.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of Rwanda on the occasion of its national day.    
 In the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the president and people of Rwanda success in the work for national unity and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cape Verde
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on July 2 sent a message of greetings to President of Cape Verde Pedro Pires on the occasion of the 26th anniversary of its independence and the proclamation of its republic.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, the government and people of Cape Verde on this occasion.    
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the people of Cape Verde progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A gift was presented to leader Kim Jong Il from a friendship delegation of the China association for international friendly contact.
 It was handed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Shen Weiping, vice-president of the association, who is on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nigerian senate
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nigerian senate
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the senate of the national assembly of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
 The head of the visiting delegation of the senate of the Nigerian national assembly Muktar Ahmed Mohammed Arwa, vice-chairman of the senate standing committee on agriculture and rural development of the national assembly of Nigeria, handed it to Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Cuban minister of revolutionary armed forces
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Cuban minister of revolutionary armed forces
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a gift from general Raul Castro Ruz, minister of the revolutionary armed forces of the Republic of Cuba.
 It was conveyed today to vice marshal Kim Yong Chun, chief of the KPA general staff, by colonel general Alvaro Ropez Miera, vice-minister of the revolutionary armed forces and chief of the general staff of Cuba, on a visit to the DPRK.
